intro: Monarthrocarpus, commonly known as the African sand dollar, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Olacaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plants are characterized by their small, succulent leaves and showy, yellowish or orange flowers. Monarthrocarpus species typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
